*** CHAPTER NEWS AND EVENTS ***

2 April 2024

McLean Rotary Presentation

Represented AUSA and the GWC as the featured speaker at the McLean Rotary Club Meeting in McLean Virginia. Presented the video on Pont du Hoc as the lead in to a presentation on AUSA Goals, Objectives, Mission and Functions, and Benefits of membership followed by a detailed presentation on the George Washington Chapter. Great audience with interesting questions about AUSA and the organization's support to Soldiers and Soldier Families in today's environments. Discussed the Chapter footprint and the management of a Chapter with over 30,000 members, with a mix of Association Partners, Industry Partners, Community Partners, Individual and Basic Members while working the daily interaction of member issues.

2 April 2024

Tartan Tattoo

GWC donated seats to this event for military families.

Proceeds from Washington Tattoo events support our veterans' mental health program, Rudiments to Recovery, our underserved youth program, Rudiments to Opportunity, and the John Michael Reilly Memorial Scholarship that supports service member-related young musicians on their music education journey.

4 April 2024

D-Day 80 Anniversary Exhibit Opening

On 4 April 2024, Julie Kaplan, Karen Lowe, and Glenn Yarborough attended the National Museum of the U.S. Army's opening reception to introduce their newest exhibit, the D-Day 80th Anniversary Exhibit. Well over 100 guests including 4 WWII veterans, General Eric and Patty Shinseki, several members of our Allied forces, many retirees, benefactors, and friends of the Museum attended the opening. The evening's program included remarks made by the Museum Director, President of the Army Historical Foundation, and the Chief Curator. Guests were invited to tour/view the new exhibit on the 2nd floor of the Museum

The WWII veteran that Karen and Julie met, thanked and had great dialogue with towards the end of the eve was drafted at age 18, and landed on the beaches of Normandy shortly after turning 19th. He turns 100 on December 27th of this year (s

It was a wonderful evening to recognize such an important part of the Army's history, and to continue to "help our soldiers' stories live on forever."

6 April 2024

E-9 Breakfast Meeting

​​​

SGM (R) Mark Reilly, Chapter VP NCO/Soldier Programs and CEO for the Washington Tattoo a communith partner of the GWC ,coordinated the monthly E9 Breakfast at the Vienna Inn, (120 Maple Ave. Vienna, VA 22180) on Saturday April 6th at 9:00 a.m. We had representation by the US Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, and Coast Guard.

Although smaller due to spring break and holidays it was still a powerful and mighty group.

Approximately, 10 Senior NCOs participated in this event across the services. This is a monthly event where the senior NCOs break bread, reconnecting with friends, network and discuss issues affecting Soldiers, Sailors, Airmen and Marines. This event is also a membership event where the benefits of being an AUSA member are discussed. George Washington Chapter AUSA funded the coffee. The next event will be conducted on 4 May 2024.

13 April 2024

Operation Deploy Your Dress

On Friday, April 12, AUSA Family Readiness hosted a Sip N See reception at the Military Women's Memorial, prior to an Operation Deploy Your Dress Pop Up Event. Miranda Jones, Vice President, Emerging Leaders, George Washington Chapter, has been volunteering with ODYD organizing, repairing, and sorting hundreds of donated dresses. Operation Deploy Your Dress’s primary goal is to improve the quality of life of military families by offsetting the high cost of attending formal military functions, especially for junior servicemembers. ODYD assists in bridging the ever-growing gap between the military and civilian communities by offering a tangible way for the American public to show their appreciation for the service and sacrifice of our military service members and their families.

Pictured left to right: Holly Dailey, Director, Family Readiness, AUSA

Clare Tomasetti, Chief of Staff, Military Women's Memorial

Miranda Jones, VP Emerging Leaders, George Washington Chapter AUSA

Marilla Cushman, Senior Advisor to the President, Military Women's Memorial

19 April 2024

George Mason University ROTC Military Ball

Represented AUSA and the George Washington Chapter at the George Mason University Army ROTC Military Ball and Awards Ceremony. Was presented the plaque below in recognition of the George Washington Chapter's support for the GMU Army ROTC Patriot Battalion.

20 April 2024

Howard University Joint Military Ball

Col (Retired) Glenn Yarborough supported and represented the GWC and AUSA at the Howard University Joint Military Ball and Awards presentations held at Patton Hall, JBM-HH on 20 April 2024.

4 May, 2024

E9 Breakfast Meeting

SGM (R) Mark Reilly, Chapter VP NCO/Soldier Programs and CEO for the Washington Tattoo a community partner of the GWC ,coordinated the monthly E9 Breakfast at the Vienna Inn, (120 Maple Ave. Vienna, VA 22180) on Saturday May 4th at 9:00 a.m. We had representation by the US Army, Navy, Air Force, Marines, and Coast Guard.

Another fantastic E9 Networking breakfast!

Thank you everyone that came out. Our founder and friend Jeffery Stitzel hosted our hashtag#ChangeOfResponsibility ceremony and the official handing over of the “ceremonial cup”

☕️☕️☕️

Also, it was great to introduce Virginia D. Commissioner Chuck Zingler to this amazing community so that we can better help support our hashtag#veterans and Veteran hashtag#FamiliesAlthough smaller due to spring break and holidays it was still a powerful and mighty group.

Approximately, 14 Senior NCOs participated in this event across the services. This is a monthly event where the senior NCOs break bread, reconnecting with friends, network and discuss issues affecting Soldiers, Sailors, Airmen and Marines. This event is also a membership event where the benefits of being an AUSA member are discussed. George Washington Chapter AUSA funded the coffee. The next event will be conducted on 1 June 2024.

7 May 2024

GWC Luncheon and General Membership Meeting

Proudly Featuring Guest Speaker

Mr. Andrew Evans, SES

Director, ISR Task Force

ODCS G-2

Tuesday, 7 May 2024

11:30 AM – 1:15 PM

Army Navy Country Club

Arlington, VA

Mr Evans presented an outstanding presentation on the current ISR environment and his interaction with the young Soldiers, Families and Cadets was most rewarding.

NOTE: The Carlin Family was selected as the AUSA 2d Region Family of the Year!

Nominated to AUSA National HQ for AUSA Family of the Year

13 May 2024

Emerging Leaders

Mrs Miranda Jones attended a book signing for Cheryl Mason, former Chairman of the Board of Veterans Appeals at the VA. She sat with Holly Dailey and they enjoyed talking about AUSA and all the amazing things that the Chapters are doing to support Family Readiness.

15 May 2024

Project Overwatch Police Week Donation

This year, our efforts sponsored five officers from two different states. The officers were flown to our Nation's capital and supplied with lodging, sponsor swag bags, and several VIP events. The Chapter's efforts directly assisted with providing logistical support for our first responders. Additionally, Military Police from 3d U.S. Infantry Regiment (The Old Guard) had an opportunity to share in the events with our honored first responders.

23 May 2024

On May 23, 2024, between 5:00 AM and 9:30 AM, SGM-R Randall Bethea, representing GWC, actively participated in honoring the nation's fallen. He joined the 3rd US Infantry Regiment (The Old Guard) to place approximately 400,000 flags at gravesites in Arlington National Cemetery. This involvement by the Chapter’s representative strengthens bonds with soldiers through shared experiences and highlights AUSA’s steadfast support for active-duty service members. Interactions between chapter representatives and soldiers ranged widely, encompassing discussions on current and future technological advancements such as MHS Genesis and IPSA-A and the significance of soldier-driven innovation. Spending time with a trusted former service member fosters an environment for exchanging ideas and facilitates personal and professional development for all involved. Similar opportunities in the coming summer months include Organization Days and the Best Squad Competition.

​​​​​​​​​​​

24 May 2024

Middleburg Community Center

Veterans Appreciation Picnic

GWC Sponsorship

SGM Mark Reilly, US Army Retired represented the GWC at the Middleburg Community Center Veterans Appreciation Picnic

​​​A fun time was had by all!

1 June 2024

E9 Breakfast Meeting

SGM (R) Mark Reilly, Chapter VP NCO/Soldier Programs, conducted the monthly E9 Breakfast at the Vienna Inn,The Breakfast was held at the Vienna Inn (120 Maple Ave. Vienna, VA 22180) on Saturday 1 June at 9:00 a.m. Approximately, 10 senior NCO's participated in this event across the services.

This is a monthly event where the senior NCOs break bread, reconnecting with friends, network and discuss issues affecting Soldiers, Sailors, Airmen and Marines, and included The Washington Tattoo, a community partner of the George Washington Chapter. This event is also a membership event where the benefits of being an AUSA member are discussed. Thanks to the George Washington Chapter AUSA for the coffee.

4 June 2024

The Chapter awarded 46 Scholarships totaling $38,750 to the applicants below.

A special shoutout to the PenFed Foundation, RTX, and Crowned Grace International for their generous support to the Scholarship Program.

25 June 2024

GWC Members Reception

National Museum of the United States Army

1775 Liberty Ave, Fort Belvoir VA

6-8 PM

This GRATIS gathering is our way of …

THANKING our Partners, Sponsors, Members

HONORING our 2024 Scholarship Recipients and their Families

WISHING our great Army a Happy 249th Birthday

SHOWCASING the National Museum of the United States Army!

BG (Ret) Burt Thompson, President Army Historical Foundation welcomes the attendees at the membership reception providing a history of the Museum and AUSA patronage.

CP's/Sponsors/Members

Scholarship Awardees Attending

249th Army Birthday Celebration

Mrs Karen Lowe, BG (R) Jack Haley, BG (R) Burt Thompson, LTC (R) F.D. Winter

Reminders

​​​​​

The GWC Educational Scholarship Golf Tournament

12 October 2024

Reston National Golf Course

11875 Sunrise Valley Drive, Reston, VA

In Memoriam

Major General Carl H. McNair, US Army Retired

Reston National Golf Course is certified as a Cooperative Sanctuary by Audubon International.

The GWC AUSA Golf Tournament is an annual event to support the Chapter's Soldier, Soldier Family, and Scholarship Programs.

The GWC continues its initiative to engage and support local high schools and undergraduates in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) as well as Business and Finance curriculums.

In 2024, the chapter awarded 46 scholarships amounting to $38,750 to Soldiers, ROTC cadets and family members.

The support provided by our sponsors and community partners was instrumental in the success of this scholarship program.​​​​​

The tournament will be an outstanding offsite marketing and networking opportunity associated with the 2024 AUSA Annual Meeting.

In 2023, $29,000 was raised to support the 2024 GWC Educational Scholarship Fund. Thank you to the Sponsors and Players!

Register: Here!

Title Sponsor

*** MEMBER BENEFIT HIGHLIGHT *** ​​​​

Shop, Save, Support:

www.ausa.org/savings

To access member discount codes and links, please log in using your AUSA username and password.

AUSA​​​​ partners offer great discounts and most contribute back to AUSA for scholarships, soldier and family programs, etc.

Visit www.ausa.org/savings and be sure to click those you may not be familiar with. There are often familiar brands behind those names. Like Provengo, with savings of up to 70% on 100+ brands like 5.11, Costa, Oakley, Benchmade, Luminox, G-Shock, Coleman, Ray-Ban, Toad Fish, Vortex, and YETI. Use code AUSA for additional $15 off.

*** Donate to the GWC Educational Scholarship Fund ***

HOW TO DONATE:

Personal check made payable to George Washington Chapter AUSA. Please note that your donation is specifically for the AUSA GWC (Chapter 2101) Educational Scholarship fund. Mail checks to:

Bill Stramm

302 Arnies Loop

Cape Charles, VA 23310
